posts.post_content:
Oat, that might be true...but two goblins with one attack phase? That's not bad.  
  
As far as I can remember, Double strike means that Mr. Instigator will hit your opponent twice...meaning that for each time the opponent is hit, you get to put a goblin in play. Play your cards right, and this dude will overwhelm your opponent in no time.  
  
That's not all that over-rated. Sure, it has flaws...but it's mythic for a reason. :D
posts.html:
Oat, that might be true...but two goblins with one attack phase? That's not bad.

As far as I can remember, Double strike means that Mr. Instigator will hit your opponent twice...meaning that for each time the opponent is hit, you get to put a goblin in play. Play your cards right, and this dude will overwhelm your opponent in no time.

That's not all that over-rated. Sure, it has flaws...but it's mythic for a reason. :D

Posted By: Lateralis0ne (9/25/2009 5:23:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Both [Goblin Lackey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Lackey) and [Warren Instigator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warren Instigator) can be taken care of easily (i.e. [Grizzly Bear](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grizzly Bear)), but Warren Instigator is a great combo with [M\*\*\* Hysteria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=M*** Hysteria). So, since Warren Instigator is tougher in combat with creatures, I like him more.
  
   
What I don't like is that the card designers are using mythic status as an excuse to make unfair cards. (A good example is [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel)) In my opinion, mythic status should only be given to legendary cards (including planeswalkers) and expensive cards with huge effects. It started off this way in Shards of Alara. But it started to deteriorate, and now that it's Zendikar there are unfair cards left and right just cuz of this new rarity. They've abused this, and the fabric of MTG will be changed. Don't be surprised if something like [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) is reprinted, and they say it's "ok cuz it's mythic". X(
posts.html:
Both Goblin Lackey and Warren Instigator can be taken care of easily (i.e. Grizzly Bear), but Warren Instigator is a great combo with M*** Hysteria. So, since Warren Instigator is tougher in combat with creatures, I like him more.

What I don't like is that the card designers are using mythic status as an excuse to make unfair cards. (A good example is Baneslayer Angel) In my opinion, mythic status should only be given to legendary cards (including planeswalkers) and expensive cards with huge effects. It started off this way in Shards of Alara. But it started to deteriorate, and now that it's Zendikar there are unfair cards left and right just cuz of this new rarity. They've abused this, and the fabric of MTG will be changed. Don't be surprised if something like Black Lotus is reprinted, and they say it's "ok cuz it's mythic". X(

posts.post_content:
the only thing that makes this good is that siege gang commander is still tournament legal.  
goblins arent that good to start with, and this just takes the cake for bad as while it is costed well, its ability is useless in non-goblin heavy decks.  
  
best case scenario:  
First turn:[Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain), [M\*\*\* Hysteria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=M*** Hysteria)  
Second turn:[Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain), this dude, attack for 2 damage and 2 [siege gang commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=siege gang commander)s  
Third turn:[Forest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forest), [Mage slayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mage slayer)
